name: bet Cnc
scenarioDescription:
The bet Cnc Exoplanetary System

bet Cnc is a star with 1.7 times the mass of the Sun, and 47.2 times its radius. It is located 295.30 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.85 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

bet Cnc is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

bet Cnc b

bet Cnc b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-06. Its semi-major axis is 1.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 605.20 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, bet Cnc.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.08, which means that when bet Cnc b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 1.56 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 1.84. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of bet Cnc b is 2478.92 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, bet Cnc b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system bet Cnc, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
